definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: What led these men and women to wear their country's uniform?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼促使這些男女將士穿上這個國家的軍裝？

sentences.english: Fess - Military belt or girdle of honor.
sentences.chinese: 軍裝上的腰帶或勳章帶。

sentences.english: I would like to have had the uniform off although I did not care much about the outward forms.
sentences.chinese: 我是不拘外表形式的，但我倒很想把這軍裝脫掉。

sentences.english: I've seen the uniform change from olive drab to camouflage (retired before getting the scatter pattern).
sentences.chinese: 見過從橄欖色到迷彩服等一些列軍裝。

sentences.english: Moreover, Jing Tian has a nice smile and looks really fine in uniform.
sentences.chinese: 此外，景甜笑起來很甜，穿起軍裝也很好看。

sentences.english: I'm partial to the 1886 Japanese Imperial Army uniform.
sentences.chinese: 我更傾向於1886年日本帝國陸軍軍裝。

sentences.english: See its like the LiuQingGu armor, take to armor to cow flowers.
sentences.chinese: 見其喜歡軍裝，就把劉青家捎來的軍裝送給牛鮮花。

sentences.english: See its like the LiuQingGu armor, take to armor to cow flowers.
sentences.chinese: 見其喜歡軍裝，就把劉青家捎來的軍裝送給牛鮮花。

sentences.english: No evil can penetrate the armor of God.
sentences.chinese: 撒但無法刺透上帝的軍裝。

sentences.english: My sister is marching in her army suit looking very valiant and heroic in bearing.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐穿着軍裝邁着軍步的樣子還真是英姿颯爽。

sentences.english: The little Togruta was wearing a smart gray naval tunic and pants.
sentences.chinese: 小託格魯塔人穿了套漂亮的灰色海軍軍裝。

sentences.english: Temple prostitution sweep moth uniform light, shaking warm City banner folder.
sentences.chinese: 軍裝宮妓掃蛾淺，搖搖錦旗夾城暖。

sentences.english: For unmounted units, the WWII German Panzer two piece uniform.
sentences.chinese: 二戰德軍裝甲部隊的軍裝，沒有鑲邊。

sentences.english: But they would do a better job of it if they took off their uniforms first.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他們要幹得更好，只有先脫下軍裝。

sentences.english: The soldiers climbed into their uniforms at the sound of the warning bell.
sentences.chinese: 聽到警報鈴聲，士兵們迅速穿上軍裝。

sentences.english: I have a thing for men in uniform.
sentences.chinese: 我對穿軍裝的男士都有種特殊的好感。

definition: worn next to the skin/close-fitting/personal (servant etc)
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
